message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with error-correcting codes and their application to distributed storage systems, which are topics typically studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Distributed Systems (cs.DS) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the construction and properties of codes, which are relevant to the Coding Theory (cs.CR) and Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-categories. Finally, the paper proposes a new explicit construction of batch codes, which are used in private information retrieval and load-balancing, making the paper relevant to the Security and Privacy (cs.SI) sub-category.
